intro: Gymnopogon doellii, commonly known as the Doell's grass, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lobed flowers. Gymnopogon doellii is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native environment.
